title: How to stay alive
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Health education
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Heart - Diseases
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Diseases - Prevention
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Middle aged men - Health and hygiene
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Conduct of life
description: Warning signals of heart disease show up in eight major areas of physical health. These danger signals are dramatised by documenting the lifestyles of five apparently healthy middle-aged men who are candidates for heart attacks. Each man's doctor prescribes a change of living pattern that will greatly reduce the risk, and the extent to which the five accept their individual lifesaving prescriptions is shown. Narrated by Robert Young.
